   Kirsten Gillibrand
   stated on May 10, 2019 in a campaign stop:
   "I actually in 2005 ran on Medicare for all."

"I actually in 2005 ran on Medicare for all, the liberal issue of making
   sure people can buy into health care that they can afford," Gillibrand
   told a crowd gathered in a New Hampshire coffee shop.

Her campaign began in 2005, and in 2006 she talked about a
   Medicare for all plan that would offer a public option.
